results.headline: Keanu Reeves, as a Cheating Husband, Endures a Comeuppance in ‘Knock Knock’
results.summary_short: The actor plays a father who succumbs to a pair of women on a stormy night, only to awaken afterward to find himself tormented by them.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Knock Knock

results.display_title: Winter on Fire: Ukraine's Fight for Freedom
results.headline: ‘Winter on Fire’: The View From the Trenches of a Political Uprising
results.summary_short: This documentary by Evgeny Afineevsky captures the immediacy of the street protests in Kiev in early 2014 that resulted in the ouster of Ukraine’s president.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Winter on Fire: Ukraine's Fight for Freedom

results.headline: Review: ‘Unbranded,’ a 3,000-Mile Trek on Wild Horses
results.summary_short: This documentary by Phillip Baribeau combines adventure and advocacy, following four recent Texas A&M graduates on a ride from Mexico to Canada.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Unbranded

results.display_title: The Prime Ministers: Soldiers and Peacemakers
results.headline: Review: ‘The Prime Ministers: Soldiers and Peacemakers’ Tackles Israeli History
results.summary_short: Based on the writings of Yehuda Avner, who served under several Israeli prime ministers, this documentary serves as an information dump.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Prime Ministers: Soldiers and Peacemakers

results.headline: Review: Stephen Daldry’s ‘Trash’ Is in the ‘Slumdog Millionaire’ Vein, With Sugar
results.summary_short: A coming-of-age story with a political twist, set against the backdrop of a colorful garbage dump.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Trash

results.headline: Review: ‘Short Skin,’ an Anatomical Sex Comedy
results.summary_short: Duccio Chiarini’s film follows the plight of a 17-year-old boy with phimosis, which stands in the way of acting on his libido.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Short Skin

results.headline: Review: ‘Poached’ Explores Collectors Who Steal Rare Birds’ Eggs
results.summary_short: The nest raiders are mostly male and British, and the more endangered the bird species, the more coveted its eggs.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Poached

results.headline: Review: ‘Pan’ Proposes Peter and Captain Hook’s Origin Stories
results.summary_short: Hugh Jackman, Rooney Mara, Garrett Hedlund and Levi Miller star in Joe Wright’s take on how and why a certain orphan ended up in Neverland.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Pan

results.headline: Review: In Takashi Miike’s ‘Yakuza Apocalypse,’ Blood and Fur Flies
results.summary_short: This Maximalist plotter of chaos smashes together yakuza gangsters and vampires in his latest comic adventure.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Yakuza Apocalypse

results.headline: Review: In ‘Reversion,’ Memories and Motives Fuel Thriller
results.summary_short: At the core of the film is a device designed to enhance pleasant recollections.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Reversion

results.headline: Review: In ‘Dukhtar,’ a Mother and Daughter’s Dangerous Dash for Freedom
results.summary_short: In Afia Serena Nathaniel’s directorial debut, a Pakistani woman and her 10-year-old take to the road to escape plans for the child to be wed to an adult.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dukhtar

results.headline: Review: ‘A Woman Like Me,’ About Grappling With Terminal Illness
results.summary_short: Dying of cancer, the director Alex Sichel kept a video diary while creating a fictional account of her treatment.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Woman Like Me

results.headline: Review: ‘A Faster Horse’ Tells the Ford Mustang’s Story
results.summary_short: This film celebrates the 50th anniversary of the car, from its mid-1960s beginnings to today.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Faster Horse

results.headline: Review: ‘(T)error’ Documentary Follows an Informant in an F.B.I. Inquiry
results.summary_short: This documentary raises questions about the agency’s methods, as an informant is told to persist with an inquiry after he concludes that its target is not a serious threat.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of (T)error

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Forbidden Room,’ a Submarine Full of Dark Imagery
results.summary_short: This Guy Maddin film, zany one minute, pompous the next, indulges in every imaginable cinematic trickery.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Forbidden Room

results.headline: Review: ‘Talvar,’ With Irrfan Khan, Depicts a Double Murder’s Muddied Waters
results.summary_short: Meghna Gulzar’s film is a fictionalized account of a sensational true-life crime in India.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Talvar

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Martian,’ Marooned but Not Alone
results.summary_short: Matt Damon plays a stranded astronaut scrambling to stay alive and return to Earth in this science-fiction thriller by Ridley Scott.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Martian

results.headline: Review: In ‘Taxi,’ a Filmmaker Pushes Against Iranian Censorship From Behind the Wheel
results.summary_short: Jafar Panahi’s third feature since 2010, when he was barred from pursuing his profession, has shades of his earlier works and bristles with topical concerns.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jafar Panahi's Taxi

results.headline: Review: ‘This Changes Everything’ Sweetly Confronts Climate Change
results.summary_short: This documentary, inspired by Naomi Klein’s book of the same name, coats complex issues in a deceptive simplicity.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of This Changes Everything

results.display_title: Taken By Storm: The Art of Storm Thorgerson and Hipgnosis
results.headline: Review: ‘Taken by Storm,’ About the Mind Behind a Design
results.summary_short: Storm Thorgerson and his psychedelic album covers are the focus of “Taken by Storm,” a documentary by Roddy Bogawa.
